root.text:
Another question:
We want to run e2e tests on our CI on regular basis with Canton.
Is there a way to do it? maybe run Canton containers? did someone do it?

elements.text:
Another question:
We want to run e2e tests on our CI on regular basis with Canton.
Is there a way to do it? maybe run Canton containers? did someone do it?

text:
<@U03QSP8LP9T> I'm trying to start the localnet and I'm having issues.
I've set `LOCALNET_DIR` and `IMAGE_TAG=0.3.21`
The Canton container won't start (see the full error log below).

`CantonVersion 33 is not supported! The supported versions are 32, dev. Please configure one of these protocol versions in the DomainParameters`
Changed it in the code to 32 and this message not appearing any more (was I supposed to?)

`Unknown key`
Still many this kind of errors

What am I doing wrong?

```{"@timestamp":"2025-06-11T07:25:27.486Z","@version":"1","message":"GENERIC_CONFIG_ERROR(8,0): Cannot convert configuration to a config of class com.digitalasset.canton.config.CantonEnterpriseConfig. Failures are:
  at 'canton.mediators.mediator.init.generate-topology-transactions-and-keys':
    - (/app/sv/on/app.conf: 56) Unknown key.
  at 'canton.mediators.mediator.init.identity.type':
    - (/app/sv/on/app.conf: 57) Unknown key.
  at 'canton.monitoring.logging.delay-logging-threshold':

  at 'canton.participants.app-provider.init.generate-topology-transactions-and-keys':
    - (/app/app.conf: 43) Unknown key.
  at 'canton.participants.app-provider.init.identity.type':
    - (/app/app.conf: 44) Unknown key.
  at 'canton.participants.app-provider.parameters.initial-protocol-version':
    - (/app/app.conf: 80) CantonVersion 33 is not supported! The supported versions are 32, dev. Please configure one of these protocol versions in the DomainParameters. 
  at 'canton.participants.app-user.init.generate-topology-transactions-and-keys':
    - (/app/app.conf: 43) Unknown key.
  at 'canton.participants.app-user.init.identity.type':
    - (/app/app.conf: 44) Unknown key.
  at 'canton.participants.app-user.parameters.initial-protocol-version':
    - (/app/app.conf: 80) CantonVersion 33 is not supported! The supported versions are 32, dev. Please configure one of these protocol versions in the DomainParameters. 
  at 'canton.participants.sv.init.generate-topology-transactions-and-keys':
    - (/app/app.conf: 43) Unknown key.

","logger_name":"c.d.c.CantonEnterpriseApp$","thread_name":"main","level":"ERROR","level_value":40000,"location":"CantonConfig.scala:1689","error-code":"GENERIC_CONFIG_ERROR(8,0)"} ```

text:
Hey <@U03HMUTQ5F0>,
To clarify stuff: We need to track rewards generated during a day by validators.
So we need to have a precise data for rewards generated historically
This allows to get the historical transactions of a wallet but there is only one parameter called `page size` that only gives the last transactions of a validator. It also needs a different Bearer token for each different validators.
How can I complete my task knowing that `/v0/transaction` is deprecated and dont take a precise validator as argument? cc <@U04KTMNDYNP> <@U08JYBDSK0V>

elements.text: Hey

,
To clarify stuff: We need to track rewards generated during a day by validators.
So we need to have a precise data for rewards generated historically
This allows to get the historical transactions of a wallet but there is only one parameter called
page size

that only gives the last transactions of a validator. It also needs a different Bearer token for each different validators.
How can I complete my task knowing that
/v0/transaction
is deprecated and dont take a precise validator as argument? cc

text:
The GSF, or another of the Super Validators, will announce here when the migrated synchronizer is up and available. This typically takes between 90 minutes and three hours.

Validator nodes should catch up to the current state before attempting the migration to the new synchronizer. *The legacy / prior synchronizer will remain available until Monday, June 23rd.*

user_profile.real_name: Digital Asset Support for GSF Operations
user_profile.name: wayne.collier

' has failed with an exception. Retrying after a number of 39 failures, and after 1078 milliseconds.

This was the diff for the canton participant deployment (some values REDACTED):
```canton-test, canton-splice-participant, Deployment (apps) has changed:
  # Source: splice-participant/templates/patched_resources.yaml
  apiVersion: apps/v1
  kind: Deployment
  metadata:
    labels:
      app: canton-splice-participant
+     <http://app.kubernetes.io/instance|app.kubernetes.io/instance>: canton-splice-participant
+     <http://app.kubernetes.io/managed-by|app.kubernetes.io/managed-by>: Helm
+     <http://app.kubernetes.io/name|app.kubernetes.io/name>: canton-splice-participant
+     <http://app.kubernetes.io/version|app.kubernetes.io/version>: 0.4.1
+     <http://helm.sh/chart|helm.sh/chart>: splice-participant-0.4.1
    name: canton-splice-participant
    namespace: canton-test
  spec:
    replicas: 1
    selector:
      matchLabels:
        app: canton-splice-participant
    strategy:
      type: Recreate
    template:
      metadata:
        annotations: {}
        labels:
          app: canton-splice-participant
+         <http://app.kubernetes.io/instance|app.kubernetes.io/instance>: canton-splice-participant
+         <http://app.kubernetes.io/managed-by|app.kubernetes.io/managed-by>: Helm
+         <http://app.kubernetes.io/name|app.kubernetes.io/name>: canton-splice-participant
+         <http://app.kubernetes.io/version|app.kubernetes.io/version>: 0.4.1
+         <http://helm.sh/chart|helm.sh/chart>: splice-participant-0.4.1
      spec:
        containers:
        - env:
          - name: JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS
            value: -XX:+UseG1GC -XX:MaxRAMPercentage=75 -XX:InitialRAMPercentage=75
              -Dscala.concurrent.context.minThreads=8 -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError
              -XX:HeapDumpPath=/persistent-data
          - name: CANTON_PARTICIPANT_POSTGRES_SERVER
            value: canton-splice-postgres
          - name: CANTON_PARTICIPANT_POSTGRES_PORT
            value: "5432"
          - name: CANTON_PARTICIPANT_POSTGRES_SCHEMA
            value: participant
          - name: CANTON_PARTICIPANT_ADMIN_USER_NAME
            valueFrom:
              secretKeyRef:
                key: ledger-api-user
                name: splice-app-validator-ledger-api-auth
                optional: false
          - name: AUTH_JWKS_URL
            value: <https://login.microsoftonline.com/REDACTED/discovery/v2.0/keys>
          - name: AUTH_TARGET_AUDIENCE
            value: REDACTED
          - name: CANTON_PARTICIPANT_POSTGRES_PASSWORD
            valueFrom:
              secretKeyRef:
                key: postgresPassword
                name: postgres-secrets
          - name: CANTON_PARTICIPANT_POSTGRES_DB
            value: participant_1
-         image: <http://REDACTED.dkr.ecr.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/decentralized-canton-sync/docker/canton-participant:0.3.21|REDACTED.dkr.ecr.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/decentralized-canton-sync/docker/canton-participant:0.3.21>
+         image: <http://REDACTED.dkr.ecr.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/decentralized-canton-sync/docker/canton-participant:0.4.1|REDACTED.dkr.ecr.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/decentralized-canton-sync/docker/canton-participant:0.4.1>
          livenessProbe:
            failureThreshold: 5
            grpc:
              port: 5061
              service: liveness
            initialDelaySeconds: 600
            periodSeconds: 60
            timeoutSeconds: 10
-         name: participant
+         name: participant-1
          ports:
          - containerPort: 5002
            name: lg-adm-api
            protocol: TCP
          - containerPort: 5001
            name: lg-api
            protocol: TCP
          - containerPort: 7575
            name: json-api
            protocol: TCP
          - containerPort: 10013
            name: metrics-api
            protocol: TCP
          readinessProbe:
            failureThreshold: 3
            grpc:
              port: 5061
            initialDelaySeconds: 5
            periodSeconds: 5
            timeoutSeconds: 10
          resources:
            limits:
              cpu: "4"
              memory: 32Gi
            requests:
              cpu: "0.4"
              memory: 3Gi
        initContainers:
        - command:
          - bash
          - -c
          - |
            until errmsg=$(psql -h canton-splice-postgres -p 5432 --username=cnadmin --dbname=cantonnet -c 'create database participant_1' 2>&1); do
              if [[ $errmsg == *"already exists"* ]]; then
                echo "Database participant_1 already exists. Done."
                break
              fi

              echo "trying to create postgres database participant_1, last error: $errmsg";
              sleep 2;
            done
          env:
          - name: PGPASSWORD
            valueFrom:
              secretKeyRef:
                key: postgresPassword
                name: postgres-secrets
          image: <http://REDACTED.dkr.ecr.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/decentralized-canton-sync/docker/postgres:17.5-alpine3.21|REDACTED.dkr.ecr.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/decentralized-canton-sync/docker/postgres:17.5-alpine3.21>
          name: pg-init
        nodeSelector:
          name: platform-canton-test-validator-a```

+         app.kubernetes.io/name: canton-splice-participant
+         app.kubernetes.io/version: 0.4.1
+         helm.sh/chart: splice-participant-0.4.1
      spec:
        containers:
        - env:
          - name: JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS
            value: -XX:+UseG1GC -XX:MaxRAMPercentage=75 -XX:InitialRAMPercentage=75
              -Dscala.concurrent.context.minThreads=8 -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError
              -XX:HeapDumpPath=/persistent-data
          - name: CANTON_PARTICIPANT_POSTGRES_SERVER
            value: canton-splice-postgres
          - name: CANTON_PARTICIPANT_POSTGRES_PORT
            value: "5432"
          - name: CANTON_PARTICIPANT_POSTGRES_SCHEMA
            value: participant
          - name: CANTON_PARTICIPANT_ADMIN_USER_NAME
            valueFrom:
              secretKeyRef:
                key: ledger-api-user
                name: splice-app-validator-ledger-api-auth
                optional: false
          - name: AUTH_JWKS_URL
            value:

- name: AUTH_TARGET_AUDIENCE
            value: REDACTED
          - name: CANTON_PARTICIPANT_POSTGRES_PASSWORD
            valueFrom:
              secretKeyRef:
                key: postgresPassword
                name: postgres-secrets
          - name: CANTON_PARTICIPANT_POSTGRES_DB
            value: participant_1
-         image: REDACTED.dkr.ecr.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/decentralized-canton-sync/docker/canton-participant:0.3.21
+         image: REDACTED.dkr.ecr.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/decentralized-canton-sync/docker/canton-participant:0.4.1
          livenessProbe:
            failureThreshold: 5
            grpc:
              port: 5061
              service: liveness
            initialDelaySeconds: 600
            periodSeconds: 60
            timeoutSeconds: 10
-         name: participant
+         name: participant-1
          ports:
          - containerPort: 5002
            name: lg-adm-api
            protocol: TCP
          - containerPort: 5001
            name: lg-api
            protocol: TCP
          - containerPort: 7575
            name: json-api
            protocol: TCP
          - containerPort: 10013
            name: metrics-api
            protocol: TCP
          readinessProbe:
            failureThreshold: 3
            grpc:
              port: 5061
            initialDelaySeconds: 5
            periodSeconds: 5
            timeoutSeconds: 10
          resources:
            limits:
              cpu: "4"
              memory: 32Gi
            requests:
              cpu: "0.4"
              memory: 3Gi
        initContainers:
        - command:
          - bash
          - -c
          - |
            until errmsg=$(psql -h canton-splice-postgres -p 5432 --username=cnadmin --dbname=cantonnet -c 'create database participant_1' 2>&1); do
              if [[ $errmsg == *"already exists"* ]]; then
                echo "Database participant_1 already exists. Done."
                break
              fi

              echo "trying to create postgres database participant_1, last error: $errmsg";
              sleep 2;
            done
          env:
          - name: PGPASSWORD
            valueFrom:
              secretKeyRef:
                key: postgresPassword
                name: postgres-secrets
          image: REDACTED.dkr.ecr.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/decentralized-canton-sync/docker/postgres:17.5-alpine3.21
          name: pg-init
        nodeSelector:
          name: platform-canton-test-validator-a

```[2025-06-11 18:38:54] argocd  (git)-[main]- $ k get pods

participant-859bdb97bc-f6rbg     1/1     Running   0          23d
postgres-0                       1/1     Running   0          23d
validator-app-5574fb4677-v68zf   1/1     Running   0          2d6h
wallet-web-ui-5967fd5b5-mknvd    1/1     Running   0          15d

Defaulted container "validator-app" out of: validator-app, validator-init (init)

1```

text: How much time do we have to upgrade once this was posted here in the channel?

text:
If you see here <https://demerzelsolutions.slack.com/archives/C08AP9QR7K4/p1749647375843179>

it says until when the legacy synchronizer will be available (in this case for testnet it is 12 days), but I think if you take too long you might be penalised in the liveness reward

elements.text:
The GSF, or another of the Super Validators, will announce here when the migrated synchronizer is up and available. This typically takes between 90 minutes and three hours.

Validator nodes should catch up to the current state before attempting the migration to the new synchronizer.
The legacy / prior synchronizer will remain available until Monday, June 23rd.

text: This message was deleted.

As far as I understood, that's true
As soon as SVs are back again, the timer starts, and your validator node will miss all rounds between the migration of SVs and your own
12 days are for catching up with the old synchronizer to have a dump for the migration

text:
Hi Team, as part of upgrading TestNet from `0.3.21` to `0.4.1` , we have set the `migration.migrating` to `true`  in *`standalone-validator-values.yaml`* .

We are also looking to upgrade DevNet from `0.4.0`  to `0.4.1` . We have already set set the `migration.migrating` to `true`  in *`standalone-validator-values.yaml`* when we upgraded the DevNet from `0.3.21` to `0.4.0` . Do we still need that to be set when going from `0.4.0`  to `0.4.1` for DevNet?
